intro: Breweria somalensis, commonly known as the Somali breweria, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Breweria somalensis is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its resilience in dry climates.
